result.execSummary:
The defendant Lashawn Maurice Owens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on May 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

JUDGE PROTASIEWICZ, BRANCH 24 WILL NOT BE IN SESSION ON MAY 21, 2015.  CASE RESCHEDULED TO MAY 26, 2015 AT 1:30 AM.  PLEASE NOTIFY YOUR CLIENT OF THE CHANGE.  IF THIS DATE IS INCONVENIENT, PLEASE CONTACT THE CLERK AT 414-278-4775 TO RESCHEDULE.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Lashawn Maurice Owens not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael Jude in court.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State needs to determine ATR length.  Stipulation for agreed upon request for a new court date signed and filed.  Status conference scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with 6008 W FLORIST AVE.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Lashawn Maurice Owens in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Lashawn Maurice Owens in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
